front.div:
A group of similar cells united to perform a specific function.
A part of an organism consisting of an aggregate of cells having a similar structure and function.
A soft thin (usually translucent) paper.
Create a piece of cloth by interlacing strands of fabric, such as wool or cotton; "tissue textiles".
A grouping of cells that are similarly characterised by their structure and function, such as muscle or
nerve tissue.
